title: Avitta ophiusalis
text:
Avitta ophiusalis is a <a href="moth">moth</a> of the family <a href="Noctuidae">Noctuidae</a> first described by <a href="Francis%20Walker%20%28entomologist%29">Francis Walker</a> in 1859. It is found in <a href="India">India</a>n subregion, <a href="Sri%20Lanka">Sri Lanka</a>, <a href="China">China</a>, <a href="Japan">Japan</a>, <a href="Sundaland">Sundaland</a>, <a href="Sulawesi">Sulawesi</a>, <a href="Queensland">Queensland</a>, <a href="Solomon%20Islands">Solomon Islands</a>, <a href="Vanuatu">Vanuatu</a>, <a href="Fiji">Fiji</a> and <a href="New%20Caledonia">New Caledonia</a>.
Forewings narrow and pale grey brown. A faint transverse fasciation present. Conspicuous darker marks are found at the reniform which look like a hawk in flight.
